pathAssistantSteps.info:
This ‘Assessment’ stage enables you to assess an opportunity in terms of internal experience, expertise, capacity and risk before it progresses to the proposal or tender stage.

Use Assessment outcome and Supporting Comments fields to capture the assessment result.

The 'Contract' stage signifies that the client has accepted the proposal and is ready to formalise agreement with a Contract with QUT.

Use the Contracts Lifecycle Management System (CLMS) to create and manage the contract process.

This ‘Development’ stage shows that the opportunity is ready for Proposal development. Proceed with proposal initial drafting, distribute your Proposal for internal review, feedback, and/or to the client for review.. Use the ‘Proposal Status' and 'Summary’ field to capture the status and key information around the proposal.

Once the proposal is submitted, check ‘Proposal Submitted’, which will move the opportunity to Submitted stage to track the outcome.

This ‘Identify’ stage enables you to record and explore opportunity related to international development and training initiatives.

Use ‘Description’ field to describe the potential opportunity.

This ‘Submitted’ stage confirms that a Proposal or tender is submitted awaiting response.

Use the Proposal Outcome and comments field to record the outcome of the Proposal Stage.
